channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Air India Plane Crash Report Says Fuel to Engines Was Cut Off
item.description: A focus on the fuel switches in a preliminary assessment raised questions about the pilots’ actions, but much is still unknown about Flight 171.

item.title: David Gergen, Adviser to Presidents and Political Commentator, Dies at 83
item.description: He served under Nixon, Ford, Reagan and Clinton before becoming a top editor and a familiar TV pundit. “Centrism doesn’t mean splitting the difference...

item.title: Judge Blocks Trump Administration Tactics in L.A. Immigration Raids
item.description: A federal judge temporarily halted the administration from making indiscriminate arrests based on race and denying detainees access to lawyers, in a l...

item.title: Mark Snow, Who Conjured the ‘X-Files’ Theme, Is Dead at 78
item.description: It took a misplaced elbow, a quirk of Los Angeles geography and some whistling from his wife to produce one of television’s most memorable melodies.

item.title: After Texas Disaster, Trump Shifts His Tone on FEMA
item.description: Earlier this year, President Trump suggested he wanted to shutter the agency. Now, he says his aides “fixed it up in no time.”

item.title: How Netanyahu Prolonged the War in Gaza to Stay in Power
item.description: Secret meetings, altered records, ignored intelligence: the inside story of the prime minister’s political calculations since Oct. 7.

item.title: How to Panic Italians? Jack Up the Price of Espresso.
item.description: Prices for coffee beans have risen, but in a country where coffee drinking is a ritual, customers demand cheap espresso. That has left coffee bars in ...

item.title: Air India Plane Crash Report Says Fuel to Engines Was Cut Off
item.description: A focus on the fuel switches in a preliminary assessment raised questions about the pilots’ actions, but much is still unknown about Flight 171.

item.title: When It’s This Hot, ‘We Are Enduring, Not Living’
item.description: How one man gets by in the unbearable and inescapable heat of Pakistan’s biggest and most unlivable city.

item.title: California pampers its chickens and Americans pay the price, Trump argues in new DOJ lawsuit
item.description: The DOJ lawsuit blames California's animal welfare laws for soaring egg prices. Activists cry bird flu.

item.title: Markets wobble after Trump threatens Canada with 35% tariff over alleged ‘flow of Fentanyl’
item.description: The S&P 500 fell 0.33%, the Nasdaq dropped 0.23%, and the Dow dipped 0.63%.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto and stablecoin infrastructure startup Zerohash to raise $100 million at an almost $1 billion valuation
item.description: The company is the latest beneficiary of venture capital’s booming interest in stablecoins.

item.title: OpenAI’s $3 billion deal with AI coding startup Windsurf collapses, as Google swoops in for licensing deal
item.description: Windsurf will continue to operate as an independent company

item.title: Jamie Dimon breaks with ‘idiots’ in Democratic Party, saying they ‘have big hearts and little brains’
item.description: "They do not understand how the real world works," said the JPMorgan Chase CEO. "Almost every single policy rolled out failed."

item.title: Russia Sees France as Its Main Enemy in Europe, French General Says
item.description: During a rare news conference on Friday, the head of the French military, Thierry Burkhard, said Russia remains a “lasting, close” threat.
